Storage.java : Add Storage.java
Deadline.java : change the d_time from string to LocalDate. Event: change the start and end from string to LocalDate. Make the chatbot understand the format yyyy-MM-dd

A-MoreOOP Ui: deals with interactions with the user Storage: deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file Parser: deals with making sense of the user command TaskList: contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list Command classes Add JavaDoc for each file

build.gradle: add checkstyle plugins

ParserTest.java: Add a unit test for Paser class TaskListTest.java: Add a unit test for TaskList class
ParserTest.java: add javadoc TaskListTest.java: add javadoc
All classes: Follow the Coding Standard
FindCommand.java: Add this file for the new feature"find"
checkstyle.xml: add the new checkstyle file suppressions.xml: add the new file
Level-10 Add GUI
DukeException.java: Use Java varargs feature

Localization: Add local package for event and deadline classes User's system language settings can affect the displayed language in the program. This inconsistency can lead to potential confusion for users who might be expecting content in English.
commitResults.messageBody:
To ensure a consistent user experience, it's vital to standardize
the display language.

Let's introduce a local package for the event and deadline classes
to ensure that the program output is always in English, irrespective
of the user's system language settings.

Opting for a local package approach allows us to have better control
over the localization settings without relying on external variables
like system settings.

Assert feature: Document assumptions in key classes In complex systems like ours, it's essential to have clear documentation of the assumptions at different parts of the code. This not only improves readability but also aids in debugging potential issues in the future.
commitResults.messageBody:
To ensure these assumptions are evident and actively checked during
runtime, the assert feature is a suitable tool.

Let's integrate the assert feature into DialogBox.java, Duke.java,
Parser.java, TaskList.java, Event.java, MainWindow.java, and Ui.java.
This will help in conveying and verifying our assumptions in these
critical parts of the code.

Note: I am utilizing the built-in assert feature of Java, not JUnit
assertions, for this purpose.

Code quality: Refactor for improved maintainability Maintaining high code quality is paramount for the longevity and scalability of our project. Over time, as code evolves, it's crucial to revisit and refactor parts that may have become less optimal or diverged from best practices.
commitResults.messageBody:
In this commit, a critical examination of the codebase was
undertaken. Several areas were identified and refactored to enhance
readability, maintainability, and adhere to our coding standards.

These changes not only make the codebase cleaner but also ensure
that future developers can understand and modify the code with
greater ease.

It's important to note that while making these quality improvements,
care was taken to preserve the existing functionality and ensure
backwards compatibility.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #6 from StevenLiudw/heads/A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody: Code quality: Refactor for improved maintainability

commitResults.messageTitle: Event.java: Integrate Java Streams for data processing Java Streams provide a modern, declarative approach to data manipulation, allowing for more readable and concise code.
commitResults.messageBody:
In `Event.java`, traditional iterative approaches were replaced
with the Streams API. This transition streamlines various
operations, making them more intuitive and reducing the risk
of common iterative errors.

By adopting Java Streams, we're also aligning with current Java
best practices, ensuring that our code remains up-to-date with
contemporary Java development patterns.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #7 from StevenLiudw/A-Streams
commitResults.messageBody: Event.java: Integrate Java Streams for data processing
